EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
The PPG Refinish - Lima Distribution Center (DC) complies with applicable Ohio, and US EPA regulations and applicable Department of Transportation requirements.
PPG's EHS Policy incorporates the elements of several voluntary global industry initiatives, including Responsible Care; and Coatings Care, which help companies manage safe and environmentally responsible practices in the chemicals and coatings industries.  Employees at the Lima DC are trained in accident prevention, hazard communication, emergency response, safe material handling practices, and fork truck driving safety.  Central to PPG's focus on safety and the environment is its EHS Policy. The policy provides the guidelines under which PPG markets, distributes and manufactures products globally in a responsible manner that protects employees, neighbors, customers and the environment. 
II. Regulated Substances Handled
PPG Refinish - Lima Distribution Center  is owned and operated by PPG Industries, Inc (PPG) and stores automotive refinish paints, primers, and associated products. These products are distributed to both internal refinish distribution centers and external distributors throughout North America and worldwide. Products are stored in various containers including aerosol spray cans. These aerosol spray cans contain propane, butane, isobutane, and methyl ether, which are used as propellants.  These four materials are regulated flammable substances under the EPA RMP regulation.  The aerosol products are stored in a separate storage area designed for this purpose.
III. Worst-Case Scenario:
Worst-case analysis consisted of a 1-lb release resulting in a vapor cloud of 0.01 miles (0.013km / 52.8ft). The flammable aerosols are stored within the facility in a designated storage area; therefore the vapor cloud would be contained within the facility walls.
IV. General Accidental Release Prevention and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps:  
The PPG Refinish - Lima Distribution Center compli

es with EPA RMP regulations for the safe storage of flammable aerosols. Under the RMP regulations, the facility's aerosol storage process is classified as a Program Level 1 because the worst-case scenario does not result in off-site impacts and there have been no accidental releases in the past five years that meet the RMP criteria.
V. Five Year Accident History
In the last 5 years at PPG Refinish - Lima Distribution Center facility, there have been no releases that results in an on-site or off-site impact.
VI. Emergency Response Procedures:
PPG Refinish - Lima Distribution Center coordinates emergency response activities with the Fort Shawnee Township Fire Department, St. Riata's Medical Center, and Allen County Sheriff's Department EMA/LEPC. Additionally, the facility periodically reviews and trains employees on the written emergency response plan and evacuation procedures.
VII. Planned Changes to Improve Safety:
Prevention programs utilized at the PPG Refinish - Lima Distribution Center include a fire prevention plan, equipment inspections, fire suppression system, inventory and storage controls and employee training. These systems and safe guards are periodically assessed for effectiveness, at least every 5 years.
